oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Cabinet card of a Spanish-American War soldier
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This unidentified Spanish-American War soldier is from Rhea County and may have the last name of Kelly or Boyd. The solider wears a standard US belt plate and holds a "Trap-Door" Springfield Rifle. The photogrphic studio is identified as Bushnell of San Francisco and Oakland, California. This may identify the soldier as possibly being a member of the 1st Tenn. Inf. Regt. as they returned from the Philippines via San Francisco.
